intro: Eriophyllum jepsonii, commonly known as Jepson's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in coastal scrub habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Eriophyllum jepsonii is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native environment.
